events.title: NAGPRA Teach In
events.description: The ASUCM External Office invites the UC Merced community to a powerful teach-in on the Native American Graves Protection and Repatriation Act (NAGPRA), a law grounded in Indigenous resistance and cultural sovereignty. This event will provide students and community members with an in-depth understanding of NAGPRA, the history of California's repatriation efforts, and the responsibilities institutions like UC Merced have in upholding accountability, challenging colonial practices, and uplifting Native nations. All UC Merced students, staff, faculty, and community members are invited to take part in this learning opportunity to engage deeply, listen to others, and join the broader movement in demanding justice for Indigenous peoples.

events.title: ASUCM Scavenger Hunt
events.description: ASUCM invites you to participate in a scavenger hunt, visit other departments, learn more about on-campus resources, and win a special prize. This event is designed to encourage you to explore the various departments across our vibrant campus, allowing you to discover the wealth of resources available to you as a student. Please pick up your bingo cards in the ASUCM office and begin!

events.title: Jaggo Night
events.description: A cultural event showcasing the tradition of "Jaggo" in a Punjabi wedding. Jaggo is a Punjabi wedding tradition involving carrying a pot that is lit up with lamps and walking through the village. This tradition is a way of inviting the village to the wedding and getting blessings for the bride and groom. In this event, we will do a step-by-step performance showcasing the Jaggo tradition as a way to teach the UC Merced student community about Punjabi cultural traditions.

events.title: Gathering
events.description: Join us for Chi Alpha Gatherings at UC Merced! Wednesdays at 7pm in COB2 130, we gather for a welcoming time of community, worship, prayer, and engaging in God's Word. Whether you're exploring faith, looking for meaningful friendships, or wanting to grow deeper in your walk with Jesus, you'll find a place here. Everyone is welcome! 7-9pm

events.title: Pilipino Cultural Night 16
events.description: Pilipino Cultural Night (PCN) is a student-produced theatrical performance that highlights Filipino and Filipino American culture, history, and identity through an original storyline interwoven with traditional dances, music, and modern acts.

events.host: American Society of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
events.title: End of the semester celebration
events.description: This event is an end-of-semester celebration designed to bring students together for a fun and creative way to unwind after a busy term. Participants will have the opportunity to build gingerbread houses or paint ornaments, enjoying a festive and relaxed atmosphere. This event aims to foster community, encourage creativity, and provide a joyful space for students to connect with peers and celebrate the accomplishments of the semester.

events.title: Tiny Health Tales General Body Meeting #7
events.description: Tiny Health Tales is a club that is dedicated to improving health literacy across the San Joaquin Valley. To do this, we create videos that educate others about prevalent health issues in the Valley, such as asthma, diabetes, ADHD, and the flu.
